verb.description: Help (someone), typically by doing a share of the work.
examples: a senior academic would assist him in his work
their presence would assist in keeping the peace
he assisted her to find employment

noun.description: An act of helping, typically by providing money.
examples: the budget must have an assist from tax policies

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French assister, from Latin assistere take one's stand by, from ad- to, at + sistere take one's stand.
